item.title: Covid: Quarantine for Covid contacts could be scrapped
item.description: If a trial is successful, close contacts of people with Covid may no longer have to self-isolate for 10 days.

item.title: North Korea accuses Joe Biden of pursuing hostile policy over its nuclear programme
item.description: The denouncement comes as the White House prepares to unveil its "calibrated" approach to North Korea.

item.title: Caitlyn Jenner opposes trans girls in women's sports as unfair
item.description: The former Olympic athlete, who came out as a trans woman in 2015, is running for California governor.

item.title: The man who lives on one of the UK's remotest islands
item.description: As lockdown restrictions began to ease, a conservationist from NI moved to a remote UK island.

item.title: Princess Charlotte celebrates sixth birthday
item.description: A photo of the fourth in line to the throne, taken by her mother, is released to mark the day.

item.title: Don't trust caller ID on phones, says Ofcom
item.description: The service should not be used as a means of verifying identity in the battle against fraud, Ofcom says.

item.title: Surgery in the womb: 'I've done the best for her'
item.description: Helena Purcell travelled to Belgium for an NHS-funded procedure on her unborn baby's spina bifida.

item.title: Fintona: Police officer knocked unconscious at bar
item.description: One officer was knocked out and another was also punched at the premises in County Tyrone.

item.title: Sweden's IVF programme for single women not 'as good as hoped'
item.description: In 2016, single women in the country were given the same rights as couples to access fertility treatments.

item.title: Oscar winning actress Dukakis dies aged 89
item.description: Dukakis was a celebrated stage actress before winning fame on screen in 80s hits like Moonstruck.

item.title: Sports Direct rated lowest in customer satisfaction survey
item.description: The retailer was criticised for its after sales service and product guarantees in the survey of 10,000 shoppers.

item.title: Derek Chisora loses heavyweight clash to Parker
item.description: Joseph Parker recovers from being knocked down in the opening 10 seconds to beat Derek Chisora on points.

item.title: The Papers: 'Three steps to normal life'
item.description: Sunday papers cover the easing of England's lockdown, and a possible vaccine plan for schoolchildren.

item.title: Walton-on-the-Naze: 'People are almost panic buying beach huts'
item.description: Beach huts have never been so in demand in an Essex seaside town - what's all the fuss about?

item.title: Blossoms singer Tom Ogden: The joy of headlining the UK's first post-lockdown gig
item.description: Stockport band Blossoms will perform for 5,000 people on Sunday, with no masks or social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus: The impact on the deaf community
item.description: Fresh calls for change are being made as the deaf community continues to be disproportionately affected by the pandemic.

item.title: Dirty Vegan star nears end of cross-Atlantic row
item.description: Celebrity chef Matt Pritchard injures his back rowing the Atlantic for charity in a four-man crew.

item.title: Zero waste bus delivers healthy food to Johannesburg
item.description: Johannesburg's inner city residents have been given access to a zero waste mobile grocery store.

item.title: Mali: The world's 'most dangerous peacekeeping mission'
item.description: British troops have joined what is considered the world's most dangerous UN peacekeeping force in Mali.

item.title: Week in pictures: 24 - 30 April 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Do you know where plastic waste in the oceans is coming from?
item.description: The Ocean Cleanup suggests plastic pollution comes from more rivers in the world than previously thought.

item.title: Charity shops: Six things to check before you drop off your old stuff
item.description: "We don't want your dirty pants" - charity shops are asking people to call before donating, but why?

item.title: The young woman trying to adopt her friend
item.description: Arina hopes to formally adopt her friend Nina, whom she looked during the Covid pandemic.

item.title: Sadiq Khan: 'I never wanted to be a culture war poster boy'
item.description: Sadiq Khan on the pandemic, recession and his spat with former US President Donald Trump.

item.title: India Covid-19: Fact-checking misleading claims on oxygen treatments
item.description: Families affected by Covid in India are being misled by dubious online claims about oxygen treatments.

item.title: Line of Duty: Five unanswered questions for the series six finale
item.description: Ahead of the series six finale, these key questions definately need more than "no comment".

item.title: Lebanon Easter biscuit woes symbolise crumbling economy
item.description: With the cost of living spiralling, even maamoul is beyond the reach of many families.

item.title: Then and now: When silence descended over Victoria Falls
item.description: Victoria Falls is one of the natural wonders of the world, yet in 2019, it fell silent.

item.title: Long-distance relationships are tough - but lockdown helped this couple
item.description: "In the first lockdown we couldn't see each other. This is round two, just an ocean apart."

item.title: Youngs rules himself out of contention for Lions tour
item.description: England scrum-half Ben Youngs withdraws from contention for the British and Irish Lions tour of South Africa because of family reasons.

item.title: Selby & Murphy to meet in final after fine comebacks
item.description: Mark Selby will meet Shaun Murphy in the World Championship final after he came from behind to seal a 17-15 victory over Stuart Bingham.

item.title: Taylor edges Jonas in stunner to retain world titles
item.description: Ireland's Katie Taylor retains her world titles in a thrilling contest against Great Britain's Natasha Jonas.

item.title: A familiar look on a 'bizarre' weekend - all you need to know before Portuguese Grand Prix
item.description: Valtteri Bottas adds a new dynamic to the unfolding narrative of the 2021 Formula 1 season.

item.title: How have Rangers turned the Old Firm derby tide?
item.description: BBC Scotland takes a look at how Rangers have turned the Old Firm derby tide against Celtic.

item.title: 'We can put the champagne in the fridge' - Man City beat Palace and could win title this weekend
item.description: Manchester City could clinch the Premier League title on Sunday after two goals in the space of 83 seconds see off Crystal Palace.

item.title: Everton join race for Aguero - Sunday's football gossip
item.description: Everton enter race for Aguero, Salah says no talks with Liverpool over new deal, Ramos still hoping for two-year Real Madrid contract, plus more.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: When can I holiday abroad and where is on the green and red lists?
item.description: A so-called "green list" of countries is being drawn up where quarantine won't be required when you return to the UK.

item.title: Covid: What is the rule of six and what are the social distancing rules?
item.description: Lockdown rules have been eased further across the UK - more people can meet up outside.

item.title: Covid: Is Europe lifting lockdown restrictions?
item.description: Are European countries relaxing restrictions put in place to control a new wave of infections?

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: When does the stamp duty holiday in England and Northern Ireland end?
item.description: What is the stamp duty holiday and when will it finish?

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go.... and who with?
item.description: The rules on having a holiday in the UK have been relaxed - but restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid: Restaurants and pubs are reopening, but what are the rules?
item.description: Northern Ireland follows England, Scotland and Wales in allowing venues to reopen outdoors.

item.title: The Cribbar: The story behind Newquay's big wave surf spot
item.description: The Cribbar is a fearsome surf spot that demands respect from even the most experienced surfers.

item.title: Loch Lomond and the Trossachs rubbish fills more than 1,000 bags
item.description: Visitors are urged to help keep Loch Lomond and the Trossachs tidy after a major clean-up operation.

item.title: Children of the 90s study: 'I feel privileged to be part of it'
item.description: In 1991, Bristol University began tracking 14,000 pregnant women - and it's still studying their children.

item.title: Book sales surge in 2020 as UK rediscovers love of reading
item.description: Sales of fiction, non-fiction and audio books all jumped last year, the industry body says.

item.title: NHS heroes to feature in Royal Society of Portrait Painters exhibition
item.description: Images of medical staff on the frontline of the Covid-19 battle will be a highlight of the show.
